ai.summary: The Letchworth Greenway is a demanding long distance hike in the United Kingdom. Spanning about 46.5 km, it is suitable for experienced hikers who relish a hard challenge and varied terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: The route traverses a mix of surfaces, including well maintained footpaths, country lanes, pastoral fields and woodland trails, with occasional road sections. Expect uneven ground, gentle to steep gradients, and some exposed stretches. Navigation may require attention in rural sections.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long and strenuous hike. Plan for a full day or two with ample daylight. Check weather conditions and be prepared for changes. Carry a map and compass or GPS, and let someone know your itinerary. Mobile reception can be patchy in rural areas. Watch for mud, uneven footing, crossing traffic on road sections, and seasonal hazards such as flooded paths.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Layered clothing plus a waterproof outer shell
Backpack with at least 20-30 liters capacity
Map and compass or GPS device
Emergency whistle and basic first aid kit
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Mobile phone with offline maps and power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (approximately March to October) in the UK.
